===Etymology===
Matisoff considers this to be derived from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*swa-n||garlic}}, but more likely this may be a plant imported from the {{w|Western Regions}} in the {{w|Qin Dynasty|Qin}}–{{w|Han Dynasty|Han}} era. The relatively late attestation and the earlier form of {{zh-l|卵蒜}} attest to the latter theory.

Compare {{cog|sa|लशुन|ल'''शुन'''}}, {{cog|pi|lasuṇa}}, {{m|pi|lasuna}}. The Old Chinese reconstruction was revised to a *''-or'' rhyme in the Baxter–Sagart system, akin to its homophone {{zh-l|*算|to calculate}}. Hence compare {{cog|fa|سیر|tr=sir||garlic}}, {{cog|kho|sārmā-||the plant ''Basella cordifolia'' or ''B. lucida'' or ''B. rubra''}}, {{cog|hu|sárma||''Ornithogalum'' sp.}}, as well as (controversial) {{cog|tut-pro|*sera||a kind of garlic}} ({{cog|tr|sarımsak}}, {{cog|mn|саримс}}).

Either way this word is cognate with the second syllable of {{cog|my|ကြက်သွန်||onion}}, {{m|my|ကြက်သွန်ဖြူ||garlic}}.
